metadata.title: CVE-2021-27803 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was discovered in how p2p/p2p_pd.c in wpa_supplicant before2.10 processes P2P (Wi-Fi Direct) provision discovery requests. It couldresult in denial of service or other impact (potentially execution ofarbitrary code), for an attacker within radio range.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm4
wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm4
wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm4').
wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm4').
